page.title: 14Public Houses in Dunmow
page.content: The Great Dunmow area has a wide variety of country public houses, which form the main socialising point for most people of the 17 years and over. Alcohol served in public houses forms 80% of all drink sales. The restrictions on serving alcoholic drinks allow only persons of 18 years and over to be served. Prices for the popular pint of beer range from 75 - 85p, lunches from 50p to Â£2.50, depending on the size of the placed order. All the public houses within Great Dunmow also serve light lunches, usually between 12 and 2 o'clock. Most popular amongst these is a ploughman's lunch, followed by a various range of sandwiches and rolls. People also take part in pool, snooker, darts, or dominoes.
